ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study; The code for each individual study
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Staff code number of person completing this form
Notes: 999= Missing Data

ElementDescription: Other living situation, describe
Treatment setting, record the setting where client was receiving treatment when first identified for screening. Other specify
Medication information
Patient's overall attitude toward treatment and medication (positive vs. negative, voluntary compliance vs. coerced compliance)
Family's/Caregiver's overall attitude toward treatment and medication
Reasons for compliance
Are you willing to take your medication because: Perceived daily benefit: You believe the medicine helps you feel better?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you willing to take your medication because: Positive relationship with prescribing clinician: Your relationship with your prescribing doctor influences you?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you willing to take your medication because: Positive relatinship with therapist: Your relationship with your therapist influences you?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you willing to take your medication because: Positive family belief: Someone in your family or a friend believes you should take medicine?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you willing to take your medication because: Relapse prevention: You believe taking medication prevents your illness or symptoms from returning?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you willing to take your medication because: Pressure/force: You are pressured or forced to take medication?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you willing to take your medication because: Fear of rehospitalization: You are afraid of being rehospitalized?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Reasons for noncompliance
Are you reluctant to take your medication because: No perceived daily benefit: You believe medication does not help you feel better?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Negative relationship with clinician: Your bad relationship with your prescribing doctor influences you?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Negative relationship with therapist: Your bad relationship with your therapist influences you?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Practitioner opposed to meds: One of your practitioners does not believe you should be taking the medication?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Family/friend opposed to meds: Someone whose opinion is important to you is against your taking the medication?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Access to treatment problems: You have difficulty getting to your appointments, and/or difficulty getting meds?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Access to treatment problems specifier
Notes: 1 = Symptom-related problems; 2 = Logistical problems; 3 = Both symptom-related and logistical problems

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Embarrassment or stigma over meds/illness: You feel embarrassed about taking medication?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Financial obstacles: You don't have enough money to pay for treatment or medication?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Substance abuse: You would rather take other drugs or alcohol?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Denial of illness: You don't believe you have a mental illness?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Medication currently unnecessary: You don't believe that you currently need the medication?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Distressed by side effects: The side effects of the medicine are too upsetting to you?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Distressed by side effects specifier
Notes: 1 = Current side effects; 2 = Fear of future side effects; 3 = Both current side effects and fear of future side effects

ElementDescription: Are you reluctant to take your medication because: Desires rehospitalization: You feel more comfortable in the hospital?
Notes: 1 = None; 2 = Mild; 3 = Strong; 9 = Not Assessable; -9 = Not Applicable

ElementDescription: ROMI Scale 1: Prevention
ROMI Scale 2: Medication Affinity
ROMI Scale 3: Influence of Others
ROMI Compliance Composite Score
ROMI Scale 4: Family Influence
ROMI Scale 5: Denial/Dysphoria
ROMI Scale 6: Rejection of Label
ROMI Scale 7: Logistical Problems
ROMI Scale 8: Negative Therapeutic Alliance
ROMI Noncompliance Composite Score
Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: You don't feel any better after taking the medication
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: Although you may have needed them in the past, you don't currently need the medication
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: You don't believe you ever had a mental illness (emotional problem) that needs medication
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: You feel that medication interferes with achieving certain goals or life aspirations
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: The side effects of the medicine are too upsetting to you
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: You feel embarrassed about taking medications
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: You look "medicated" to other people
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: A family member or a friend believes that you should not be taking medicine
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: You have difficulty getting to your appointments, and/or difficulty getting medications
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Reasons why you are reluctant to take your medication: You stop your medications before or during the times you drink or get high
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Disagree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Strongly Agree

ElementDescription: Do you sometimes use complementary and alternative medicines (herbs or supplements, not including daily vitamins) either with or instead of your bipolar medicines?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes
